meanings.sent1: I always uphold my friends when they need help.
meanings.sent2: It is important to uphold the rules of the game.
meanings.sent3: The tree branches uphold the weight of the swinging children.
meanings.sent4: Her unwavering faith in herself upholds her through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The strong pillars uphold the structure of the building.

meanings.sent1: I will uphold my promise to meet you at the park.
meanings.sent2: The witness's testimony helped to uphold the suspect's guilt.
meanings.sent3: The stamp on the document upholds its authenticity.
meanings.sent4: Her signature will uphold the contract's validity.
meanings.sent5: The judge's decision to uphold the verdict was final.

meanings.sent1: The court will uphold the jury's verdict.
meanings.sent2: It is the duty of the police to uphold the law.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's decision to uphold the student's grade surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The council's vote to uphold the ban on fireworks was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent5: The referee's call to uphold the goal was met with cheers from the crowd.
